column4: if you take the initial pains to read the manpages, you'll begin to appreciate them more than any other sources of documentation -- they're sometimes written in terse language to get right to the point and be as brief as possible, so you dont have to do much scrolling  and that does save you loads of time
you can have something like ~/data-dir/ntfs and ~/data-dir/ext2 and have both partitions mounted on them
i use tab completion for pastebinit anyway so while i may make such an error here without no tab completion it is much less likely in bash
